article.title: MSM/RD: Coupling Markov state models of molecular kinetics with reaction-diffusion simulations

multiple_choice_question.text: In Figure 2b, what type of trajectory is represented by the green line entering the MSM domain and immediately exiting without hitting a core?
Figure 2c illustrates the MSM/RD scheme. What key information is extracted from the MD simulation to parametrize the coupling between the MSM and RD domains?
choices: The full interaction potential energy surface.
Entry and exit trajectories of the ligand crossing the MSM domain boundary.
The average time the ligand spends in each MSM state.
The diffusion constant of the protein.

multiple_choice_question.text: Figure 3d shows implied timescales for the MSM constructed from the ligand diffusion model. What conclusion can be drawn from the relatively flat lines across different lag times?
choices: The choice of lag time has a significant impact on the accuracy of the MSM.
The system can be considered Markovian for the range of lag times tested.
The system exhibits extremely fast dynamics.

multiple_choice_question.text: Figure 4c shows the binding rate of CO to myoglobin as a function of concentration in the MSM/RD simulations. What is the significance of the linear relationship observed in the plot?
choices: It indicates that the binding kinetics are independent of ligand concentration.
It suggests a complex, multi-step binding mechanism.
It supports the validity of the MSM/RD model in accurately capturing the binding process.
It highlights the limitations of the MSM/RD approach at high ligand concentrations.
